criteria: Understanding of exponent properties (product of powers, quotient of powers, power of a power, zero exponent, negative exponent).
Ability to simplify expressions with integer exponents.
Application of exponent properties to generate equivalent numerical expressions.
descriptions: Demonstrates no understanding of exponent properties.
Shows limited understanding; struggles to apply exponent properties correctly.
Understands some exponent properties but makes frequent errors in application.
Demonstrates a general understanding of exponent properties but occasionally makes mistakes.
Applies exponent properties accurately in most cases, with only minor errors.
Demonstrates a thorough understanding of exponent properties and applies them accurately and efficiently.
Unable to simplify expressions with integer exponents.
Struggles to simplify expressions, even with guidance.
Can simplify basic expressions but has difficulty with more complex problems.
Simplifies most expressions correctly but may make errors with negative exponents or multiple operations.
Consistently simplifies expressions with integer exponents accurately.
Simplifies complex expressions with integer exponents efficiently and accurately, demonstrating a strong command of the rules.
Unable to generate equivalent numerical expressions using exponent properties.
Attempts to generate equivalent expressions but is unsuccessful or makes significant errors.
Can generate equivalent expressions for simple problems but struggles with more complex cases.
Generates equivalent numerical expressions but may not always choose the most efficient method.
Consistently generates correct equivalent numerical expressions using appropriate exponent properties.
Demonstrates a sophisticated understanding of how to manipulate exponent properties to generate a variety of equivalent numerical expressions effectively.
